insight.title: How money is created out of thin air
insight.subtitle: Why banks can create money when they lend

sections.text: Most people believe banks lend out money that already exists.They imagine banks as vaults — taking deposits from savers and handing that same money to borrowers.
That intuition feels natural. It’s also wrong.
In modern economies, most money is created when banks issue loans.When a bank approves your loan, it does not transfer existing money from someone else’s account.
Instead, it creates new money digitally by crediting your account with a deposit. Money appears — not from printing presses, but from accounting entries.
Because money is created through lending, economies are highly sensitive to interest rates and financial confidence.
Money is not a fixed pool. It expands and contracts based on trust, rules, and incentives.

news.title: HRW: Civilians Face Escalating Attacks and War Crimes in Ukraine
news.description: Civilians in Ukraine continued to face grave conflict-related abuses in 2025, as increasingly targeted and indiscriminate Russian attacks led to rising civilian deaths, injuries, and widespread destruction, Human Rights Watch said in its World Report 2026.
